lead_paragraph: PRESSURE IS ON AT CITI  |  The new chief executive of Citigroup, Michael L. Corbat, “may have to impress quickly, given the pent-up frustrations among shareholders,” DealBook’s Peter Eavis writes. With the stock price having fallen 89 percent under Mr. Corbat’s predecessor, Vikram S. Pandit, investors want the new leader to speed up the bank’s overhaul and be more transparent about the process. But it was not clear on Tuesday what his actual plan was. “Today’s changes do not alter the strategic direction of Citi, which we believe is a good one,” Mr. Corbat said during his first public conference call as chief executive. Still, he suggested the personnel change itself signaled change: “I wouldn’t minimize the impact you can have on a place.”

headline.main: The Pressure Is On at Citigroup
